title: Ensure that only organizationally managed/approved public groups exist
description: Microsoft 365 Groups is the foundational membership service that drives teamwork across Microsoft 365. With Microsoft 365 Groups, you can give a group of people access to a collection of shared resources. When a group is created via the admin panel, its default privacy value is 'Public'.
rationale: Ensure that only organizationally managed and approved public groups exist. Public groups allow access to data via Azure portal, access panel, or SharePoint URLsâ€”even without approval. These URLs can be guessed or discovered, potentially exposing sensitive information.
impact: Group owners may receive an increased number of access requests, especially for groups originally meant to be public.
remediation:
To remediate using the UI:
1. Navigate to Microsoft 365 admin center https://admin.microsoft.com.
2. Expand Teams & groups and select Active teams & groups.
3. Select the public group from the list.
4. In the group settings panel, select Settings.
5. Under Privacy, change the value to Private.
audit_ui:
1. Navigate to Microsoft 365 admin center https://admin.microsoft.com.
2. Expand Teams & groups and select Active teams & groups.
3. Review the privacy column and ensure no groups are listed as Public.
audit_powershell:
Connect-MgGraph -Scopes "Group.Read.All"

Get-MgGroup | Where-Object { $_.Visibility -eq 'Public' } | Select-Object DisplayName, Visibility

Ensure Visibility is Private for each group.

title: Ensure sign-in to shared mailboxes is blocked
description: Shared mailboxes are intended for multiple people to access and send email from a common address (e.g., support or reception). These are created with a system-generated password and should not be accessed directly.
rationale: Direct sign-in to shared mailboxes bypasses accountability. If an admin or attacker resets the password, they can log in and send emails without unique identification. Sign-in should be blocked to enforce delegated access only.
impact: Normal delegated access remains. Direct sign-in will be blocked for shared mailboxes.
remediation:
To remediate using the UI:
1. Navigate to Microsoft 365 admin center https://admin.microsoft.com.
2. Expand Teams & groups and select Shared mailboxes.
3. Note all shared mailboxes.
4. Expand Users > Active users.
5. Select the corresponding account, choose Block sign-in, and confirm.
6. Repeat for all shared mailboxes.
audit_ui:
1. Navigate to Microsoft 365 admin center https://admin.microsoft.com.
2. Expand Teams & groups > Shared mailboxes.
3. Review all shared mailboxes.
4. Expand Users > Active users.
5. For each mailbox account, open properties and ensure Sign-in blocked is shown.
audit_powershell:
Connect-ExchangeOnline
Connect-MgGraph -Scopes "Policy.Read.All"

$MBX = Get-EXOMailbox -RecipientTypeDetails SharedMailbox
$MBX | ForEach-Object { Get-MgUser -UserId $_.ExternalDirectoryObjectId -Property DisplayName, UserPrincipalName, AccountEnabled } | Format-Table DisplayName, UserPrincipalName, AccountEnabled

Ensure AccountEnabled is set to False for all shared mailboxes.
